text: Egon Piechaczek (November 16, 1931 in Chorzow, Poland - October 23, 2006 ) was a Polish football player and football manager. ==Career== He played for AKS Chorzów, Wawel Kraków, Legia Warsaw, Ruch Chorzów, Odra Opole and FSV Frankfurt. ==Coaching career== He coached Kaiserslautern and Arminia Bielefeld in Germany. He was involved in the 1971 Bundesliga scandal. He later coached PAOK, Panionios and Apollon Limassol. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2006 deaths Category:Polish footballers Category:Polish football managers Category:Arminia Bielefeld managers Category:Association football forwards Category:PAOK FC managers Category:Panionios F.C. managers Category:Panserraikos F.C. managers Category:1. title: Egon Piechaczek
